thread.title: College Notes: Capron shares first at Muskegon CC Invite
thread.title_full: College Notes: Capron shares first at Muskegon CC Invite

author: CHRIS DOBROWOLSKI cdobrowolski@record-eagle.com
title: College Notes: Capron shares first at Muskegon CC Invite
text:
College Notes: Capron shares first at Muskegon CC Invite 
Devon Capron College Notes: Capron shares first at Muskegon CC Invite By CHRIS DOBROWOLSKI cdobrowolski@record-eagle.com Record-Eagle.com 
MUSKEGON â€” Suttons Bay's Devon Capron shot a 1-over-par 73 to share first-place individual honors with three others at the Muskegon Community College Fall Invitational. 
Capron's top score helped Grand Rapids Community College shoot a team score of 293, which put them in first place for the tournament. It was the Raiders' first tournament win this season. 
MORE GOLF 
HOPE: Winton Munch (TC Central) fired an even-par 71 to tie for fourth individually at an MIAA jamboree hosted by Trine, where Hope finished second overall. The Flying Dutchmen also took third at the league tournament in Grand Rapids, an event where Munch shot a 79 to finish tied for 19th. 
INDIANA TECH: Courtney Dye (TC Central) tied her career best with a 36-hole low score of 149 to finish in a tie for first at the Illinois Wesleyan Fall Classic. Dye started the tournament with a 74, then followed with a 75 for the fourth victory of her career. The Warriors were second at the event. 
ST. MARY'S (IND.): Taylor Kehoe (TC West) fired an 86 to help the Belles get a team score of 329 to tie for third at the Kalamazoo Jamboree. 
CROSS COUNTRY 
MICHIGAN STATE: In the first attached run of her career, Amber Way (Charlevoix) finished 52nd in a time of 22 minutes, 47 seconds as the Spartans finished second at the Roy Griak Invitational. 
NORTHERN MICHIGAN: Abby Fifarek (Grand Traverse Academy) was one of eight NMU runners to finish among the top 100 runners as she finished 76th in a time of 24:57 at the Roy Griak Invitational. 
FOOTBALL 
CENTRAL MICHIGAN: Trevor Apsey (Glen Lake) saw action in a 30-10 loss to Michigan State. 
HILLSDALE: Seth Kellicut (TC St. Francis) saw action in a 38-7 loss to Indianapolis. 
MICHIGAN TECH: Derrick Diver (TC West) recorded 1 tackle in a 24-23 win over Northern Michigan. 
MICHIGAN STATE: Riley Bullough (TC St. Francis) made 7 tackles and recovered a fumble that was returned 13 yards in the Spartans' 30-10 victory against Central Michigan ... Kevin Cronin (TC West) had six kickoffs, with one going for a touchback ... Byron Bullough (TC St. Francis) saw action in the victory. 
NORTHERN MICHIGAN: Jordan Strope (TC West) started at right tackle in a 24-23 loss to Michigan Tech ... Will Stecker (Gaylord) played in the game for the Wildcats. 
NORTHWOOD: T.J. Schepperly (TC Central) and Reece Isenhart (Elk Rapids) both played in a 31-13 win against Wayne State. 
HOCKEY 
FERRIS STATE: Jared VanWormer (TC Central) was named one of the team's captains. 
SOCCER 
ALBION: Justin Kraft (TC West) had two saves in goal in a 1-0 loss to Trine ... Lauren Bensley (TC Central) took two shots in the women's team's 1-0 loss to Kalamazoo ... Maggie Troost (TC West) made three saves against Kalamazoo ... Mikenna Ray (TC West) had one shot in the loss to Kalamazoo ... Mikaela Ray (TC West) joined Bensley and Mikenna Ray in the lineup in a 3-1 loss to Olivet. 
ALMA: Zach Vandeveer (Elk Rapids) took four shots, including one on goal, in a 2-1 win over Adrian. 
AQUINAS: Michael Weber (TC St. Francis) saw action in a 2-0 loss to Cornerstone ... Jenna Erway (Cadillac) had a shot in a 1-1 tie against Indiana Tech ... Casey McDonough (Glen Lake) also saw action against Indiana Tech. 
DAVENPORT: Owen Stratton (TC Central) put one shot on goal in a 6-3 win against U-M-Dearborn. 
LAWRENCE TECH: Brandon Busuttil (TC Central) had one shot in a match against Marygrove that ended in a 3-3 draw. 
NORTHERN MICHIGAN: Madison Hamilla (Gaylord) played in a 3-0 loss to Ohio Dominican and a 2-1 loss to Walsh ... Alexandra Simmons (Gaylord) saw action in the match with Ohio Dominican. 
SPRING ARBOR: Abbey Fuller (Cadillac) had a shot on goal in a 2-1 victory against Huntington. 
WISCONSIN-PARKSIDE: Kiley Kreple (TC West) started in a 2-1 loss to Missouri-St. Louis and a 4-3 loss to Maryville. 
VOLLEYBALL 
ALMA: Dakota Pelach (Gaylord) had 5 assists and 6 digs in a 3-0 loss to Calvin. She added 4 kills, 12 assists, 5 digs and 2 blocks in a 3-0 loss to Trine ... Maggie Miller (Frankfort) recorded 3 kills and 1 block against Calvin and chipped in with 6 kills, 1 assist, 1 dig and 1 block against Trine. 
FERRIS STATE: Katie Placek (TC West) had nine kills, 1 assist, 6 digs and 2 blocks in a 3-0 win over Malone. She also had 1 kill and 1 dig as the second-ranked Bulldogs defeated Walsh 3-0 ... Jenna Way (Charlevoix) contributed 10 assists versus Malone, and had 1 kill, 8 assists and 6 digs against Walsh. 
HOPE: Courtney VanHouzen (TC West) contributed nine kills and 5 digs in a 3-0 win over Heidelberg. VanHouzen chipped in 4 kills, 1 assist, 1 dig and 3 blocks as the Flying Dutchmen beat Kalamazoo 3-0, and had 8 kills and 5 blocks in a 3-1 win over St. Mary's (Ind.) ... Callie Kostrzewa (TC Christian) had 1 kill and 2 digs in the victory against Kalamazoo. 
KALAMAZOO: Sophie Spencer (TC St. Francis) had 2 kills, 1 assist and 4 digs in a 3-0 loss to Hope, then added 2 kills, 1 assist and 2 digs in a 3-0 loss to Heidelberg ... Noa Yaakoby (Leland) contributed 2 digs against Hope, and 3 kills, 1 assist and 3 digs versus Heidelberg. 
MICHIGAN STATE: Megan Tompkins (Petoskey) had 7 kills, 1 assist, 2 digs and 5 blocks in a 3-0 victory against Indiana. She also had 8 kills, 1 dig and 4 blocks in a 3-1 loss to Purdue. 
NORTHERN MICHIGAN: Bridget Bussell (TC St. Francis) came through with 10 kills, 1 dig and 2 blocks in a 3-0 win over Lake Erie. Bussell also had 13 kills and 1 block in a 3-2 loss to Ashland ... Jessie Kushner (TC Central) played in the Wildcats' victory against Lake Erie. Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
